event: Earliest human presence in present-day Chile
Early coastal and valley communities develop fishing and agriculture
Complex Indigenous societies flourish in northern and central Chile
Mapuche culture consolidates in south-central Chile
Inca Empire expands into northern Chile
Santiago is founded by the Spanish
Prolonged Mapuche resistance limits Spanish control in the south
Bourbon reforms expand trade and strengthen colonial administration
First national junta forms, beginning the independence process
Constitution establishes a strong centralized republic
War of the Pacific expands Chilean territory in the north
Chile secures nitrate-rich regions after the war
Mass politics and social reforms reshape the political system
Military coup overthrows the civilian government
